article.title: The Herschel Planetary Nebula Survey (HerPlaNS) - a comprehensive dusty photoionization model of NGC6781

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of dust is primarily present in the dusty nebula of NGC 6781, as indicated by the inset Spitzer/IRS spectrum?
Which spectroscopic observation missed the brightest E and W "rim" regions of NGC 6781 where low-excitation and neutral lines are strongest?
Based on the ne-Te diagram, what is the approximate range of the electron temperature (Te) for the bulk of the ionized gas in NGC 6781?
What is the spatial distribution of the molecular gas component in NGC 6781, as revealed by the H2 emission?
choices: Similar to the cool, low I.P. gas and dust components, forming a pole-on cylindrical barrel structure.
Highly localized, forming a filamentary structure.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the excitation diagram of pure rotational transitions of H2 lines suggest about the H2 17.04 µm line emission?
choices: It originates from the same region as the other H2 lines.
It originates from a region with a single, uniform excitation temperature.
It originates from a region with different physical conditions than the other H2 lines.
It originates from a region with negligible excitation temperature.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the synthesized spectrum, fitted with the observed photometry points of the CSPN, indicate about the presence of IR excess in NGC 6781?
choices: The CSPN shows strong IR excess.
The CSPN shows moderate IR excess.
The CSPN shows no IR excess.
The data is inconclusive about the presence or absence of IR excess.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the best-fit distance to NGC 6781 based on comparing the CSPN luminosity (L*) with the post-AGB evolutionary tracks?
What type of gas pressure model is adopted for the Cloudy model of NGC 6781?
choices: The data does not allow to differentiate between the two types of model.
Gas pressure is not considered in the model.

multiple_choice_question.text: Based on the empirical SED and the derived CSPN luminosity, what type of PN is NGC 6781 more likely to be?
choices: The data does not allow to differentiate between the two types of PN.
The concept of density-bounded or ionization-bounded is not applicable to NGC 6781.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which grain model provides a generally better overall fit to the observed mid-IR to far-IR dust continuum in NGC 6781?
What is the reason for the overestimation of the atomic gas line fluxes, such as [O i] and [Cii] lines, in the best-fit Cloudy model?
choices: The adopted nebular abundances are incorrect.
The adopted distance to NGC 6781 is incorrect.
The model fails to account for the cold molecular component while introducing a corresponding amount of extra atomic gas component.
The model does not properly account for the presence of dust grains.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the approximate post-AGB age of NGC 6781, as inferred from comparing the best-fit Cloudy model with the post-AGB evolutionary tracks?
In which wavelength range does the amorphous carbon grain model fit the observed continuum fluxes much better than the amorphous silicate grain model?
choices: In both the mid-IR (10 - 40 µm) and far-IR (> 70 µm)
The two models fit the observed continuum fluxes equally well in all wavelength ranges.
